headline.main: Famed Destroyer Cossack Lost by British; Altmark Rescue Among Her Daring Exploits

lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 10 -- The British destroyer Cossack, famous for her exploit in releasing British prisoners from the prison ship Altmark in a Norwegian fjord in February, 1940, has been sunk, the Admiralty announced today. Captain E.L. Berthon was in command when the warship was lost.
abstract: Brit destroyer Cossack reptd sunk; no details; data on ship's history; illus
